author: pisymbol314
content: <@914307919699406908> Can we just volunteer for projects or should we wait until the selection process is done?

author: joshd4078
content: As Ethereum development is open-source, projects are always free to be worked on. However, if you are intending to join the program in a permissionless manner, I would suggest holding off on choosing a project until we have the kick-off meeting next week so that you can get a better idea of the tempo of the cohort.

Welcome! You are being added to the Ethereum Protocol Fellowship group because you submitted an application for the fourth cohort of the EPF. ```

author: sogol_malek
content:
its cool though, i have an idea for MEV extractors as gas sponsors  for my stateless account abstraction proposal. MEV Bid-Markets Make Additional Profit 
By Sponsoring The Gas Fee. This way, the Value drained by Good MEV will return to the ecosystem. Xtreamly‚Äôs gas relayers can work with the MEV extractors
MEV extractors can offer the gas fees at a lower rate than the maximum gas fee offered by the users and earn a portion of the gas fees as a reward for sponsoring. Ive still not much detail design /implementation ideas but happy to collaborte on it if anyone is intereted. I just started developing fundamentals for my EIP-X stateless account abstraction proposal that scales ethereum. https://github.com/sogolmalek/EIP-x

author: mariohavel
content: <@955481979317518367> Glad to hear that, just please read the program guide and the mentorship guide first. If you are interested to work on some project, the first few weeks are dedicated to your own research, make sure to learn about the project as much as possible and then reach out to mentor with your project proposal/outcome of your research

author: joshd4078
content: As Mario mentioned above, the first few weeks are more about learning about the core protocols generally and doing a deep dive into a particular topic once you have found a subject that is interesting to you. If you are looking to follow the tempo of the program, I would suggest spending these next weeks learning before settling into a specific project.
